item.title: An uncompromising leader who carved our democratic path
item.description: Bangladesh stands in grief today. The void created by the death of a political leader is always profound, but the demise of BNP Chairperson and former Prime Minister Khaleda Zia has multiplied that emptiness for many, for she was not merely the head of a political party, but also an uncompromising leader of the masses as well as an embodiment of humanity who fought for the people rising above partisan identity.

item.title: 2026: A year of repair, not miracles
item.description: A new year often starts with personal reflection. Each of us reflects on what went wrong, what we endured, and what we hope to change. Every Bangladeshi has their own story of loss, small gains, and ongoing struggles.

item.title: A stunning turnout at a leader’s final rites
item.description: Khaleda Zia's funeral witnessed a overwhelming turnout.
